channel.title: Perma bans
channel.description: Well I was wrongly accused of botting on my main on runescape. I submitted a appeal and it was denied. So now I am stuck with my main, perma banned, for nothing. I was wondering if after so much time can I re appeal it or just become un-banned.

item.title: Perma bans
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:47, topic:336757”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=433169.msg3722031#msg3722031 date=1314001567]
After two years, perma bans and mutes are usually flushed from the system. I’m waiting on mine, it’s been a year. ^.^
Also, JaGeX broke your ToS by viewing your site.
[/quote]
I’ve had one of my accounts removed for botting. It literally was removed (i think). I don’t think your account is going to be ‘flushed’ from their system. Also that TOS doesn’t do shit[/quote]
My friend got unbanned after two years and a few months, so I’m hoping the same for me.

Read full topic

Well I was wrongly accused of botting on my main on runescape. I submitted a appeal and it was denied. So now I am stuck with my main, perma banned, for nothing. I was wondering if after so much time can I re appeal it or just become un-banned.

BAHAHAHA, You fail bro.

Also, JaGeX broke your ToS by viewing your site.[/quote]
I’ve had one of my accounts removed for botting. It literally was removed (i think). I don’t think your account is going to be ‘flushed’ from their system. Also that TOS doesn’t do shit

item.title: Perma bans
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

After two years, perma bans and mutes are usually flushed from the system. I’m waiting on mine, it’s been a year. ^.^

Quick edit:
There was a news story a couple years ago that someone said they where going to kill themselves and they had to spent two nights in jail for wasting police time. I wouldn’t do it.

Also, JaGeX broke your ToS by viewing your site.

Read full topic

No, they just said they report such appeals to local authorities (as they should), I just have a problem with them trying to tell me what discussions I can and can’t have on my public forums.

item.title: Perma bans
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Sorry for the bump, but I think this warrants it, I just realized I received an email about this specific thread on May 24th, 2010, I never saw it before…

To Whom It May Concern,

Re: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=433169.0

I represent Jagex Limited (“Jagex”), developer and publisher of massively multiplayer online games. Jagex has owned and operated RuneScape, the well-known online multiplayer adventure game, at the website www.runescape.com since 2001. There are currently over 5 million active registered players of the game worldwide.

As part of the RuneScape gaming experience, Jagex operates an appeal system whereby players may submit an appeal if they believe there has been a mistake in applying an offence on their account for a breach of recognised rules.

Several discussion threads on your forum have come to our attention which discuss, erroneously, that providing Jagex with false claims of suicidal tendencies or personal harm will force Jagex into granting appeals.

Jagex will, under certain circumstances, escalate claims of suicide or personal harm to the local authorities in the player’s region. This may lead to local law enforcement visiting the player in question and submitting the player to an in-depth discussion on any claims made.

Jagex does not take such claims into consideration when granting or denying appeals and such discussions only serve to provide the player community with false information about Jagex practices.

Accordingly, Jagex respectfully requests that you act to remove, or disable access to, discussions listed above.

Should you require any further information regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Yours faithfully,

Richard Gemmell
Copyright & Intellectual Property

Jagex Ltd.

copyright@jagex.com
www.jagex.com | www.runescape.com

–

IMPORTANT NOTICE

The sender does not guarantee that this message, including any attachment, is secure or virus free. Also, it is confidential and may be privileged or otherwise protected from disclosure. If you are not the intended recipient, do not disclose or copy it or its contents. Please telephone or email the sender and delete the message entirely from your system.

Jagex Limited is a company registered in England & Wales with company number 03982706 and a registered office at St John’s Innovation Centre, Cowley Road, Cambridge, CB4 0WS, UK.

So since the internet content police says I need to remove this thread, of course I will!

Read full topic
